oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Styles of Country Music Opening - Jimmy C. Newman gold record presentation - 1982-05-06
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpts from the Styles of Country Music Opening performance, featuring by D. L. Menard (performer), Buck White (performer), Doc Guidry (performer), Bessyl Duhon (performer), and Jimmy C. Newman (performer) on May 6, 1982. Newman also presents his gold record for "Lache Pas La Patate" to the Country Music Hall of Fame.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: D. L. Menard; Buck White; Doc Guidry; Bessyl Duhon; Jimmy C. Newman
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified ambiance] -- D. L. Menard introduces the first tune -- The Back Door (band) -- D. L. Menard introduces the next tune -- Let's Dance (band) [unconfirmed] -- D. L. Menard introduces the next tune -- Holly Beach Waltz (band) -- D. L. Menard introduces Jimmy C. Newman -- Newman thanks the band and introduces the next tune -- Louisiana Cajun Band (Jimmy C. Newman) -- Bill Ivey talks about new additions to the Country Music Hall Of Fame -- Jimmy C. Newman talks about his gold record, which is the only cajun song to get gold -- Newman presents his gold record to the Country Music Hall of Fame -- Bill Ivey thanks Newman -- Newman introduces the next tune -- Lache Pas La Patate (Jimmy C. Newman) -- [Unidentified cajun tune] (band) -- D. L. Menard thanks the audience
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Menard, D.L.; White, Buck; Guidry, Doc; Duhon, Bessyl; Newman, Jimmy C.; Ivey, Bill;
